body:
Summer Loving

A/N: ahhhh this is my first actual oneshot and i hope you like it !! it’s basically me projecting but i think it’s super cute and fluffy so enjoy !!

Pairing: Peter Parker x reader

Your hands were conjoined as the warm breeze whipped past you. Driving on the highway, the air felt electric. The pair of earbuds connecting you played music quietly as you both thought about the trip. Your dad in his white t shirt and jean shorts humming softly to the radio peeked into the mirror to see your head placed on Peters shoulder with your eyes shut. The soft smile on his face grew as his eyes returned to the road.

It was close to sunset when you arrived to the house you’ve been going to since you were small. The excitement of sharing this with peter made you breathless. Giggling as you all piled out of the car and ran through the door, escaping the humidity and heat as the cool waves of the ac washed upon you. Memories flooded your senses as you ran up the stairs to see the interior of the house. Hands still entangled, peter squeezed your hand as he took in the house you always talked about. “Make yourself at home, pete” your dad chimed in as he started carrying bags and groceries in. You all helped put them away and decided to pick rooms. Pete and you had the back bedroom, right next to your sister’s so she could keep an eye on you.

“Wanna go watch the sunset?” The way your eyes sparkled as you asked, he knew he couldn’t say no. “Absolutely !” as everyone walked to the bay, you two decided to walk the other direction to the beach. The air turned cooler as you made your way across the busy intersection. The street lamps lessened as you made your way to the dunes. Reaching the top you sat down on the rickety bench stationed there. Shoes discarded, Peters arm came around your shoulder as his lips met your forehead. You stay like that for a while, thanking the stars for bringing you the boy of your dreams. The atmosphere was disturbed as he began tickling your sides. “What’re you thinking about?” You laughed as you began to slide off the bench, laughing. “You, and how lucky i am to have you.” You smiled as you met his eyes. His cheeks becoming pink as he took in your words. “As am i.”

You made your way back to the house, laughing as Peter gave you a piggy back ride, almost dropping you once or twice, as you went up the stairs to the first floor, the smell of pizza overwhelmed your senses. “Come grab a slice!” Your dad said as he sat himself at the head of the table. Squeezing yourself onto the bench you sat opposite of Peter. Your eyes meeting from time to time as conversation flowed from person to person. He saw how truly happy you were to be here as you laughed at one of your sisters jokes. Your demeanor completely different from how it was from your everyday life.

The dim light was still on as his head was placed on your stomach. Showing each other different memes you find and basking in each other’s company. “Good night you two!” Your sister chimes from the doorway, “Good night!” you both say back. You close the door and get ready to settle in for the night. The sheets feel cool against your legs as got under the blankets. Turning to face Peter, you smiled as he opened his arms to welcome you to his chest.

The sunlight shown through the lace curtains as you stirred. The unmistakable sound of the coffee maker running was heard from the kitchen. You lightly scooted up the bed and kissed peters cheek softly. Still sound asleep, you kissed his eyelids and then finally his lips. His eyes still closed, he began to move and stretch, entrapping you in his arms in a hug. You ran your fingertips over his face leaving tingling trails. He hummed as you giggled and he kissed the top of your nose. You escaped his grasp and got to the side of your bed.

Shuffling to the kitchen, bagels and coffee waiting for the taking, you sat at the island, stretching as you decided what kind you wanted. Peter came from down the hallway wiping the sleep out of his eyes and yawning, white t shirt and grey sweatpants hanging low on his hips. “Good morning” he said as he saw your family going about their morning routines. Taking a seat next to you, he took his hand in yours and kissed your cheek as you both went on your phones to catch up on what you missed through the night.

The breeze once again made itself evident as you sat in the low beach chair. Adjusting your sunglasses you looked over the many chairs to the water, seeing Peter, your brother, and your dad all together jumping waves. “He’s good for you.” you looked over to your sister and smiled. “What?” “He’s good for you, he gets you. Your mannerisms, your interests, he knows what makes you tick and seems to be all in. Are you?” you closed your eyes as you felt the sun on your cheeks “All the way.”

The neon lights enchanted you as you were on the tilt-a-whirl. Smushed against peter, you laughed and laughed until your stomach hurt. Getting off, still slightly dizzy, you walked into Peter who put his arms round you to help you keep steady.

“Take a walk with me?” “Of course!” Your dad nodded as you walked by and out of the park. He brought you to the bay line. The sounds of the arcade and the screams of the riders an after thought. “I’ve loves being here with you, I can really see how much your family means to you. How much this place means to you, and I wanted to thank you for taking me with you. I love you more than words can describe. Thank you for making me so happy, thank you for making every day an adventure.” “I love you too P. Thank you for coming and putting up with my family’s shenanigans.” Your laughter died down as Peter pulled something from his pocket “I wanted to give you something.” “Pete I-“ “Don’t worry, it’s not an engagement ring, I know we’re too young for that sort of commitment, but I want to be promised to you. so I got you a promise ring” He chuckles nervously as his cheeks become pinker, and you know it’s not just from his sunburn. He opens the box and it’s a small silver band with a small heart pendant on it. “It’s beautiful thank you so much, Pete.” He smiled as he slides it on your finger. You kiss as the sunsets and it’s the perfect moment. You come down. from your love induced high and look into his chocolate colored eyes. cheeks still pink from being breathless, and his freckles darkened due to his sun exposure. As you look down at the ring you see the late nights spent in Peters car, singing along to the radio and drinking slurpees. The weekends and afternoons spent in a cafe trying to study. But you also see what your future with Peter holds.

@stardusted.marvel on Instagram!

I’m on a writing break right now but feel free to message me <3

title: Nightmare | Chapter 4
body:
I tried. I really did. But I couldn’t keep that large of an illusion up for long when I was right next to it, much less when I was too far away to see it and probably also being chased by something.

I could feel it, though, I could feel the illusion as I struggled to keep it up, my mind split between running as fast as possible and keeping it up.

Beads of sweat rolled down my face and heavy breaths barely escaped my lungs as we ran.

Peter ran alongside me, keeping pace despite the fact that he could probably be running at least slightly faster than me. He glanced backward, the building fading out of sight and no signs of pursuit so far.

“I think you can drop the illusion now,”

“Just a little while longer. If I drop it now they could come after us quickly. We need to be farther away,” I explained.

“You’re using up too much strength. We could run a lot faster if you’d stop the illusion. You’re going to hurt yourself from holding it up.”

I considered his words. “I’m not going to hurt myself.”

I hope I’m not going to hurt myself. I mean, it’s magic, right? I won’t hurt myself by projecting an image. Right? Maybe it’d be like straining your muscles. Or maybe it’d be indirect; if I use up too much energy on this I could collapse later? I don’t know and I don’t want to find out.

“We’re far enough away!” Peter looks at me, silently pleading for me to listen to him.

“Fine!” I grumbled, closing my eyes as we run.

I concentrated and dropped the illusion, shaking my head to clear the headache forming from holding the illusion too long.

“Okay where to now? We have to get farther away but we also have to figure out where we are and send a message to your dad.” He questioned, trying to figure out what we need to do next.

“Uh, we need to find out where we are. Let’s try to find a map? We also need to find out how much time has passed. And try not to be the only ones out on the street because that would make it easier for them to find us.” I slowed until I was just walking casually, Peter doing the same.

“Shouldn’t we keep running?” Peter asked hesitantly, confusion lacing his tone as he looked at me.

“The first rule of going on the run is don’t run, walk,” I said, quoting something Natasha had taught me when SHIELD collapsed. God, I miss her and everyone else. Stupid accords.

Peter nodded and I looked around the street we were walking along. “There’s a convenience store right there,” I said, “there’s gotta be… something we can use in there, even if its just a map of the town.”

“Okay, let’s check it out.” He started walking in that direction; I quickly followed behind.

A bell rang as I pushed the door open, stepping inside with Peter. We looked around. The place wasn’t overly crowded and didn’t feel like it was a bad place to be. Aisles of products lined the store. There is a cashier’s desk to our left; the lady sitting behind the register seems to be working on a crossword puzzle. A sign on the wall above her reads “I HEART NEW YORK” and a clock a few feet away tells us that it’s 2:27 on Sunday. Sunday is two days after Friday. We’ve been missing since Friday! Okay, that’s not good, but we can’t freak out now.

I nodded towards the sign. “We can’t be too far if we’re still in New York.”

“New York is a big freaking place,” Peter whispered, glancing at the sign.

I shrugged, then pointed at the clock. “It’s Sunday.”

His eyes widened. “That’s… not good.”

“Nope,” I replied, trying to sound nonchalant. “Let’s keep looking through the store. Maybe we can find some way to contact my dad. If we split up we can search the store twice as fast,”

He nodded, looking like he really hated the plan. I did, too, but that’s not important. We have to find a way to get home, fast. Nightmare could be coming after us as we speak.

“I’ll go left, you go right,” Peter said, waiting for me to nod before walking away slowly. I turned and started towards the far right of the store.

I looked through every aisle carefully, trying to find a phone or something that I could use to get a message to my dad. Even though Peter and I have no money on us, if we can convince the cashier that I’m Y/N Stark, then money shouldn’t be a problem. I can come back and pay later, I just need to get a message to my dad first.

The bell chimed again as the door opened and a group of people walked in. I didn’t think much of it. We’re in a public place after all. It could be just another group of kids looking to buy some snacks for an afternoon of studying.

I continued searching, covering two more aisles before a rough hand grabbed my arm. I let out a yell and turned, trying to wrench my arm away so I could run.

“There you are!” Nightmare came around the corner, looking angry yet keeping her voice light. “I’m not even going to lie, you’re way better at escaping than you’re given credit for. I didn’t expect you to be able to get out at all, but you two got out pretty quickly.”

Oh no. Oh no, no, no, this is not good at all. She found us. Well, she found me. I really hope she didn’t find Peter.

“Let go of my arm.” I narrowed my eyes at the guard holding me, ignoring Nightmare.

Unfortunately, that just made the guy tighten his grip. I rolled my eyes and focused on Nightmare, knowing that there was going to be a red mark on my arm from his tight grip.

“So what happens now?” I ask, feeling my heart pounding. I’m scared. There are too many people here that could get hurt.

“Now, we find Spidey and continue with our plan.”

“What is your plan?” I ask, hardening my voice to hide the fear and tiredness that could probably be heard.

“Like I’d tell you,” she sneered.

“Why not?” I raised an eyebrow. I’m stalling, but, hopefully, she doesn’t know that. “Are you scared I’ll escape again and run off to tell Daddy? Ruin any chance you ever had or will have of using this plan?”

Nightmare stepped closer. “I wouldn’t start insulting me, Y/N. I have your life in my hands, I could kill you or your friend in the blink of an eye without a second thought.” I rolled my eyes. Of course, she’s going to use verbal threat like that. “Now, you’re going to go with Roland here and you’re not going to fight. Or… well we’ve got a variety of weapons that we aren’t afraid to use on you.”

Great. She’s got a variety of weapons to use and I’ve got absolutely nothing except myself. Absolutely perfect.

I nodded stiffly and let the guy still gripping my arm entirely too tightly, Roland, lead me to wherever it is that we’re going.

I don’t have very long to wonder; we end up in a deserted alleyway behind the store. Roland drags me by the arm towards a van, not saying a word. Without warning, he slams me against the van. I cry out at the sudden pain when my head hits the van. Roland quickly grabs my hands and uses actual handcuffs to secure my arms behind me, locking them a little too tightly around my wrists.

“Hey, stop! Don’t hurt her!” Peter yells when he sees me, being dragged into the alley too.

No one responds to Peter. He’s already in handcuffs, I realize. Not very reassuring. Nightmare comes around the corner, smirking.

She gives a curt nod and Roland picks me up and throws me into the back of the van.

I groan and try to sit up. I can hear Peter yelling, but I’m not sure what he’s saying. He’s thrown into the van beside me and the doors are slammed shut. I can hear the lock click.

“Y/n? Are you okay?”  Peter sounds panicked, leaning against the back wall of the van and watching as I struggle to sit up.

“Yeah, I’m good. You?”

“I’m fine. Are you sure you’re okay? Does your head hurt? It sounded really bad when it hit the van, Y/N.”

“Pete, I’m fine. Yeah, my head hurts. It doesn’t feel like a concussion though, I’m pretty sure it’s fine.”

He didn’t speak for a few minutes after that, looking up at the ceiling of the van thoughtfully. “It just scared me. I’m sorry,”

“It’s not your fault.”

[[MORE]]

I could feel it, though, I could feel the illusion as I struggled to keep it up, my mind split between running as fast as possible and keeping it up.

Beads of sweat rolled down my face and heavy breaths barely escaped my lungs as we ran.

Peter ran alongside me, keeping pace despite the fact that he could probably be running at least slightly faster than me. He glanced backward, the building fading out of sight and no signs of pursuit so far.

“I think you can drop the illusion now,”

“Just a little while longer. If I drop it now they could come after us quickly. We need to be farther away,” I explained.

“You’re using up too much strength. We could run a lot faster if you’d stop the illusion. You’re going to hurt yourself from holding it up.”

I considered his words. “I’m not going to hurt myself.”

I hope I’m not going to hurt myself. I mean, it’s magic, right? I won’t hurt myself by projecting an image. Right? Maybe it’d be like straining your muscles. Or maybe it’d be indirect; if I use up too much energy on this I could collapse later? I don’t know and I don’t want to find out.

“We’re far enough away!” Peter looks at me, silently pleading for me to listen to him.

“Fine!” I grumbled, closing my eyes as we run.

I concentrated and dropped the illusion, shaking my head to clear the headache forming from holding the illusion too long.

“Okay where to now? We have to get farther away but we also have to figure out where we are and send a message to your dad.” He questioned, trying to figure out what we need to do next.

“Shouldn’t we keep running?” Peter asked hesitantly, confusion lacing his tone as he looked at me.

“The first rule of going on the run is don’t run, walk,” I said, quoting something Natasha had taught me when SHIELD collapsed. God, I miss her and everyone else. Stupid accords.

blog.name: mysticfeather87
blog.title: If You Like Irondad
blog.description:
A blog mainly dedicated to Irondad, but sometime other things are posted.

Inbox is open for ask and prompts!

summary: What was Peter thinking during the time travel? He seemed a lot more quiet than I would imagine
question: What was Peter thinking during the time travel? He seemed a lot more quiet than I would imagine
answer:
Peter Parker was in shock, as one would usually be when seeing double of the same person. He definitely still cared for both, but he was just confused and nervous. He didn’t know how to handle the situation so he left it to the adults that did and only spoke when he needed too.

Though I agree, I should have made peter talk a bit more. Because I also believe Peter cracking jokes is his way of being able to cope with stressful and unnerving situations.

tags: based on that shirt don wore at snl
summary: For the prompt thing, someone put a picture of Don Cheadle wearing a shirt that says "protect trans kids" in the ID server, so...
question: For the prompt thing, someone put a picture of Don Cheadle wearing a shirt that says "protect trans kids" in the ID server, so imagine trans!Peter seeing Rhodey in that shirt and crying. Bonus points, Rhodey got the shirt bc of Peter. Bonus bonus points, during a fight, Rhodey actually does protect Peter. Bonus bonus bonus points, Peter protects Rhodey during a fight (maybe his braces got broken/disabled somehow)
answer:
Right when Bruce was able to synthesize am anesthetic that would work with Peters mutation, He begged to get top surgery. He knew that he wouldn’t be able to be Spider-Man during the recovery period but with a practically spandex suit, not having tits would be pretty nice. 

Sure, Mr. Stark had figured out a binder that was practically invisible and miraculously still let him breathe. He still had to take frequent breaks but he was responsible enough to take care of those kinds of things. He had so many baggy hoodies at this point that it was crazy. What? They were really convenient. 

Thankfully, Mr. Stark agreed to let him have the surgery. They did have a trustworthy group of doctors that the remaining Avengers relied on. It would be hard to find a doctor that would use a special kind of anesthetic for this random kid. 

Peter had always kind of been afraid of hospitals anyway and he had once seen a video that talked about the possibility of anesthesia awareness. Where the person was more paralyzed and felt every scalpel ripping into their body but Tony promised that they’ll have brain monitors on him so that nothing scary would happen or if it did, they’ll know and fix it immediately. 

The day of the surgery, Peter was really nervous but he had May and Mr. Stark with him and the promise that Colonel Rhodes would be there when he awoke. Ned promised to come around after school which Peter was also thankful about. He was told that he would need at least a day with intensive recovery with how intense his healing factor was. They said that he wouldn’t even have any scarring. So that was pretty rad. 

Falling asleep was easy and he felt like he had just closed his eyes before he woke up again, tit-less. With May, Tony, and Rhodey in the infirmary room waiting for him to wake up.

The first thing he noticed was Rhodey’s shirt. It was dark gray with white text that said, ‘Protect Trans Kids.’ Peter immediately smiled. The woozy effect faded away pretty quickly with Peter’s metabolism, thank god he didn’t do anything too embarrassing. Just cry and try to hug everyone even though his chest was cut into a lot. He just got half hugs. 

He recovered enough to move around after a day but still wasn’t ready to go so far as to be Spider-Man but eventually, he was. 

His first mission after surgery was with both Tony and Rhodey. Okay, it wasn’t a mission, he was just out with Tony and Rhodey at a science fair at MIT when they got ambushed by some people who recognized Tony and not in the fangirl way but in a murder-y way. 

Tony stepped in front of Rhodey and Rhodey stood protectively in front of Peter, despite Peter being the only person like that can heal from a bullet wound in like twelve hours. He was annoyed that he was the one that needed to be protected. 

Peter noticed that Rhodey wore the Protect Trans Kids shirt while this was happening and he seemed to be taking this slogan too seriously. Tony tried to negotiate with the bad guys but Peter didn’t attempt to listen. He just placed his unfolding web-shooter on his wrist and thought about what to do. 

A shot was fired and it would’ve hit Peter if Rhodey hadn’t moved his leg and let the bullet hit his leg brace. Unfortunately, the leg brace wasn’t meant to catch bullets and Rhodey started to tumble to the ground. Thankfully, Peter caught his mentors best friend and shot webs at the shooter. Tony finished them off pretty quickly and he helped Peter carry Rhodey to where Tony could fix his brace. 

“Thanks, Mr. Rhodes, I mean, I think you’re taking your T-shirt slogans too seriously,” Peter said as Tony was working on the brace, Rhodey laughed. 

“I’m taking it just as seriously as I need to, and thanks for catching me, kid.”

“Yeah, he’s good at that,” Tony muttered.

“Can we get ice cream? I think we earned it.” Both Tony and Rhodey laughed. 

“Sure bud.”

summary: What Peter would've done if he met Odin
body:
What Peter would’ve done if he met Odin

(Lets pretend Asguard and Odin are still around)

Peter looked at the black haired god from over his Norse mythology book. He had found the mans diary yesterday and had read it with Thors Norse Letters cheat sheet. Smiling he stands and goes over to Loki.

“Mr. Loki? Can you take me to Asguard? Please? I have an art project due and I want to draw you in the throne, where you belong.” Peter says smiling.

Loki looks down at him in shock. “Really? Well….have you asked Iron Dick about this?” He asks.

“No. He’s not the boss of you.” Peter says smiling.

“True. Alright, go get your supplies.” Loki spoke in a chiper tone.

———————————————-

Peter looked around them as he was brought into the throne room. Loki quickly sat on the throne as Peter put up his easel. “Come along Peter, get to it.”

Peter smiles and starts his picture unaware that Odin was only a few rooms away and getting closer. Once Peter had started on Lokis face the door opened and Odins voice boomed though the room.

“Loki! What do you think you are doing in that seat?!”

Peter turned and smirks slightly. Time to fuck with the Asguardian king.

“Who the hell do you think you are?! You will not speak to the king in that manner if you know what is good for you!” Peter yells.

Odin looked at him in shock. “And who are you boy?” Odin asks when Loki quickly stood to protect Peter.

“I am King Lokis’ personal bodyguard, Spider-Man!” Peter yells.

“What?! King? Loki is no king he-!”

“He is the child of King of the Frost Giants, King Laufeyson which made him the prince or sometimes Princess or just Loki. Since the king is dead and Loki came of age he is the King/Queen of the Frost Giants. You have no power over him and he can use your throne if he would like since he is a visiting Royalty. You will hold your tounge if you know what is good for you unless you wish to have a war between us and yourself! Do I make myself clear?!” Peter yells all in one breath.

Loki and Odin look at Peter in shock while the teen pants softly. “I need to stop talking all in one breath.” Peter whispers.

Odin looked towards Loki then at Peter. “He deserves your respect. Ever since he was a child you treated him differently and the time for that stops now. You will treat him with respect that he has been working so hard for.” Peter continues.

Odin sighs and looks at the tearful Loki. “You….you are right. Lo–King Loki I wish to offer my apologies.” Odin spoke softly.

“You can keep your apologies. I wish to no longer have any thing to do with you King Odin. Now if you’ll excuse me I need to take this young lad to see my home to finish his project so he can get an…what do they do to grade you?” Loki asks.

“An A or putting up your painting for an art award.” Peter replies.

“Ah. What he says and not a smack to the face.”

With that Loki walked towards the exit while Peter punches Odin in the balls. “You’re a horrible father!” Peter growls to the doubled over king.

———————————————-

“No.” Tony says quickly.

“Why not?” Loki asks in confusion.

“Because he already has two dads!” Bruce yells from where he was trying to pull Clint out of the labs vent.

“I can a mother to him then! Just let me adopt the spider-child!”

You will hold your tounge if you know what is good for you unless you wish to have a war between us and yourself! Do I make myself clear?!” Peter yells all in one breath.

Loki and Odin look at Peter in shock while the teen pants softly. “I need to stop talking all in one breath.” Peter whispers.

Odin looked towards Loki then at Peter. “He deserves your respect. Ever since he was a child you treated him differently and the time for that stops now. You will treat him with respect that he has been working so hard for.” Peter continues.

Odin sighs and looks at the tearful Loki. “You….you are right. Lo–King Loki I wish to offer my apologies.” Odin spoke softly.

“You can keep your apologies. I wish to no longer have any thing to do with you King Odin. Now if you’ll excuse me I need to take this young lad to see my home to finish his project so he can get an…what do they do to grade you?” Loki asks.

“An A or putting up your painting for an art award.” Peter replies.

“Ah. What he says and not a smack to the face.”

With that Loki walked towards the exit while Peter punches Odin in the balls. “You’re a horrible father!” Peter growls to the doubled over king.

———————————————-

“No.” Tony says quickly.

“Why not?” Loki asks in confusion.

“Because he already has two dads!” Bruce yells from where he was trying to pull Clint out of the labs vent.

“I can a mother to him then! Just let me adopt the spider-child!”

Home of Peter Parkrawr

question: 33, 40, or 47
answer:
Hi, Anon! I hope this is close to what you wanted!

33- “You can lie to yourself but don’t lie to me.”

40- “That’s not what I meant and you know it!”

47- “Who did this to you?”

It takes Tony three months and six days to notice the change. He notices because Pepper had shown him a video that she’d been watching of Tony and Peter three months ago- of Peter smiling, laughing, and not flinching at every loud and sudden movement and noise.

It’s a lab day the day Pepper showed Tony the video. Tony doesn’t notice the change until an hour into their lab time, when he notices Peter hunched over whatever the kid’s working on. Tony knows from experience that the position Peter’s in will hurt his neck and back. “Hey Pete?” Tony calls out.

Peter doesn’t answer. He just continues working on what Tony now realizes is his web-shooters. He’s completely immersed in what he’s doing- not paying attention to the world around him or what’s happening. Tony gets it, and he knows that just calling out Peter’s name over and over again isn’t going to snap Peter out of his focused mind. So Tony strolls over to Peter, not thinking as he puts a hand on the kid’s arm.

Apparently he should of thought about it more, because the way Peter reacts is the first red flag that Tony notices. The teen throws himself out of his chair, scrambling to the wall about six feet away with a hand raised to defend himself. His eyes are wide and staring straight at Tony’s in a wide, deer-in-headlights look. Realization on what he’s just done dawns on Peter’s pale face. He opens his mouth like he wants to say something, but nothing comes out.

The next thing Tony notices is that Peter’s jacket sleeve had rolled up during the sudden movement- revealing a hand shaped bruise around the teen’s wrist. Peter follows Tony’s line of sight, and quickly pulls his hand close to his chest.

Tony looks back into Peter’s eyes… and that’s where he notices the next thing. The mix of emotions that Tony knew because he had felt all of these when he was younger. On the bad nights where Howard had had a stressful day or night. The fear, and embarrassment, and the silent plea for help.

He notices it all in the span of ten seconds, and curses himself for not noticing sooner.

“Peter?” Tony asks softly, crouching a few feet away from the shaking teen, holding his hands up in the ‘surrender’ motion. “Peter, are you here? Are you in the lab?”

Peter is breathing heavily, curled into himself and eyes locked onto Tony. He doesn’t answer for a few moments, just opening and closing his mouth with nothing coming out. Finally, as if realizing that he just wasn’t going to be talking, Peter nods his head once.

“Okay,” Tony attempts to smile reassuringly, “Okay, can I come closer?”

There’s a pause before Peter answers, before he slowly nods again.

Tony slowly gets up before walking over and sitting down next to Peter. “Can I touch you?” He asks, because he doesn’t want to scare the kid. He wants (needs) Peter to know that he isn’t like whoever did this to him.

Peter doesn’t nod or shake his head this time. He just leans buries his head into the crook of Tony’s shoulder, and breathes in shakily. Tony carefully wraps his arms around the kid, creating an awkward kind of side hug, but he doesn’t care. Peter needs the comfort more than Tony needs the feeling of non-awkwardness.

“I’m s-so sorry,” Peter finally says, his voice muffled by Tony’s shirt. “I- I don’t…” Peter fades off into sniffles as he cries.

Tony gently shushes him while combing his fingers through Peter’s hair. “Who did this to you, Peter?”

Peter shakes his head weakly, “No one. It was just something that happened on patrol.”

“Peter,” Tony says, voice hard. He immediately regrets it when Peter flinches away from him.

Peter sits up, looking at the ground instead of Tony’s eyes, “It’s nothing. Please, just drop it.”

But the silent plea is still there, and it isn’t for Tony to drop it. It’s a plea for help, and Tony isn’t going to let the kid down. “You can lie to yourself but don’t lie to me. This isn’t nothing, Peter. Someone’s hurting you.” Someone’s been hurting you is what Tony wants to say, because how had he not noticed the differences. How ad he not noticed Peter being abused.

“Mr. Stark, no one’s hurting me,” Peter mumbles, but his voice is wrong. Mechanical as if this is something he’s been told over and over again. “It’s just to toughen me up. I’m to soft, and I need to grow up because-” Peter’s words get more and more jumbled until Tony can’t understand him.

But he’s got the gist. And the gist makes Tony want to kill the person who’s made his kid think this. “Hey, hey, hey,” Tony whispers, causing Peter to stop and peer up at the older man. “That isn’t normal, Pete. You don’t need to toughen up, and you don’t deserve what’s happening to you. No one does.”

“That’s not what I said and you know it. I never said that I d-deserve it. But May’s so happy-”

“No, Kiddo,” Tony mumbles, pulling Peter into a hug. “She wouldn’t be happy if she knew what was going on.”

Peter looks up at Tony, “But she hasn’t been this happy since B-Ben.”

“You deserve to feel just as happy as her, Peter. The person who’s doing this… he isn’t a good guy. One day, he’s going to lose his temper at May, too, because that’s how these people work, Peter.”

Peter’s eyes grow wider and more horrified at the thought of his aunt getting hurt. He looks to Tony, new tears lining his eyes, “Mr. S-Stark. Help, please, help me- I can’t do it myself. Pleasepleaseplease-” He falls into Tony’s chest, the man holding him in a protective hug.

“Don’t worry, Peter,” Tony says, rubbing the teens back as it’s racked with sobs, “He’ll never hurt you again.”

question: Peter, number 5 ❤️
answer:
What is their most cherished personal belonging? 

An old but expensive watch, left to Ben in Peter’s father’s will, and then left to Peter in Ben’s will. Peter never wears it, of course, but it stays in a locked box in his desk drawer, and sometimes he gets it out just to trace the engravings of his father and uncle’s names, promising them that he’ll live up to how good they both were. 

send me a character and a number and I’ll tell you my hc :)

Peter never wears it, of course, but it stays in a locked box in his desk drawer, and sometimes he gets it out just to trace the engravings of his father and uncle’s names, promising them that he’ll live up to how good they both were.

title: Born to be mine
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GuzKLW

by CherryPie0

Tony knows that the divorce has been really hard on his sister, so he agrees almost immediately when she asks him to look after Peter for a whole month while she’s on vacation with her new boyfriend. Still, he’s not sure what to expect; he hasn’t seen the kid in years.

He’s definitely not ready for this sweet, precious thing to enter his life and make him feel things that he knows very well he shouldn’t.

title: A Five-Year-Old Yeeted the Hammer?
body:

by chvotic

Peter looked shocked for a few moments, just holding it over his head like it weighed nothing. Then, a big grin spread over his face. “Daddy! Look! I’m worthy!”

“You… are.” Tony said unsurely, not liking the fact that the hammer was right over Peter’s head. “Why don’t you, put that down, huh? I’m sure Uncle Thor would want it back..”

Or, in which, Peter lifts Thor’s hammer and doesn’t expect what happens next.

blog.description: I go by Gay or Grump| 18 | She/They | Team Iron Man | Lesbian  | AO3 writer Sciencelings | Low-Key Artist | INFP | Tony Stark, Peter Parker, Carol Danvers, Billy Kaplan, Bobby Drake, and Harley Keener Stan | Irondad | X-Men | Anti-Starker because I’m a fucking normal person |

summary: Peter figuring out his sexual/romantic orientation because identities are difficult (not just the one behind the mask)
question: Peter figuring out his sexual/romantic orientation because identities are difficult (not just the one behind the mask)
answer:
Peter was fourteen when he realized that he might not be straight. This was also when he got bitten by a radioactive spider so he kind of postponed the whole thinking about who he liked because he was too busy sticking to things. 

Then his uncle died and he focused on that a lot with his wonderings about sexuality in the background of his mind. Then he met Tony Stark who was one of those famous people that everyone knows is not straight so he got kind of too excited. The guy wasn’t just his superhero hero, but also his hero as a person. If that makes any sense. 

It was only after the whole mess with the Vulture and May finding out about Spider-Man, that Peter was able to actually think about who the fuck he liked. It was actually pretty confusing. He saw some guys that he thought were hot and he saw girls that he liked and sometimes he didn’t feel like he liked anyone and it was just a mess while he tried to figure it out and put labels on what he felt. 

He joined LGBT groups as an ally at first because he didn’t want to confess that he was questioning what he felt and he learned all the names for what people felt. He learned that there was a difference between romantic orientations and sexual orientations and that there were names for everything. It was pretty exciting and he only ended up talking to Ned about it. 

He was never sure how May would react, although he was sure that she would still love him, he just never heard her talk about anything to do with gay stuff. But it wouldn’t matter anyway, Peter was horrible at keeping secrets and May knew her nephew inside and out. She knew when something was wrong and when he started coming home happier and with a colorful pin on the inside of his jacket. 

After a few months, she confronted him about it. At first, she had wanted him to come to her about it when he was ready but she thought that pulling off the bandage would be easier and would save him the stress. Because of course, she would support him no matter what. It was a particularly good day when she decided to bring it up. 

“So Peter… do you remember when gay marriage was legalized and then a few months later, Ultron decided to be a thing and everyone blamed this end of the world on being nice to the gays.” 

“Uh, yeah. That was weird.” 

“Do you remember how happy I was when gay marriage was legalized.” 

“I don’t… I was not politically aware.” Peter said nervously. 

“I was very happy. Do you want to know why?”

“…why…”

“Because I’m Bisexual. I mean I was in a straight relationship with your uncle but I had a lot of lesbian friends, remember Audrey?”

“Yeah, she’s the blonde one right?” 

“Yup, She’s a lesbian, and we even dated for a bit in high school.” 

“Really? So you wouldn’t be mad if I said that I uh… wasn’t straight?”

“Why would I be mad? You’re literally a vigilante on your downtime, I would much rather have you be dating your friend than catch speeding cars for fun.” 

“I’m… not dating Ned.” Peter sputtered. May raised one of her eyebrows and Peter sighed. “Okay, that one time was be trying to change out of my Spider-Man suit it doesn’t count.” 

“Uh huh… Well, no wonder you idolize Mr. Stark so much. Not many proud queer people are also superheroes.” 

“You’d be surprised.” 

“Do you have some superhero gossip Spider-Man?” May grinned. 

“I haven’t met that many superheroes but Tony likes to talk. So you know Black Widow?” Peter grinned back. He didn’t think that it would be… this easy to talk about this kind of stuff to someone who meant so much to him but it was definitely a surprise to find out that his aunt was in the community too. Later he learned that she didn’t feel like she could talk about it because she married Ben and that was a pretty straight thing to do. She didn’t feel part of the community even though she liked girls just as much as she liked guys. 

But Peter promised her that she was still perfectly queer. They googled the dates for the next pride festival. And they started to plan for it even though Peter still wasn’t sure what flags he would wear, he didn’t even know what he identified as. May assured him that he’ll figure it out eventually and for the first time in years, Peter was able to breathe again.

But Peter promised her that she was still perfectly queer. They googled the dates for the next pride festival. And they started to plan for it even though Peter still wasn’t sure what flags he would wear, he didn’t even know what he identified as. May assured him that he’ll figure it out eventually and for the first time in years, Peter was able to breathe again.
trail.content:
Peter was fourteen when he realized that he might not be straight. This was also when he got bitten by a radioactive spider so he kind of postponed the whole thinking about who he liked because he was too busy sticking to things. 

Then his uncle died and he focused on that a lot with his wonderings about sexuality in the background of his mind. Then he met Tony Stark who was one of those famous people that everyone knows is not straight so he got kind of too excited. The guy wasn’t just his superhero hero, but also his hero as a person. If that makes any sense. 

It was only after the whole mess with the Vulture and May finding out about Spider-Man, that Peter was able to actually think about who the fuck he liked. It was actually pretty confusing. He saw some guys that he thought were hot and he saw girls that he liked and sometimes he didn’t feel like he liked anyone and it was just a mess while he tried to figure it out and put labels on what he felt. 

He joined LGBT groups as an ally at first because he didn’t want to confess that he was questioning what he felt and he learned all the names for what people felt. He learned that there was a difference between romantic orientations and sexual orientations and that there were names for everything. It was pretty exciting and he only ended up talking to Ned about it. 

He was never sure how May would react, although he was sure that she would still love him, he just never heard her talk about anything to do with gay stuff. But it wouldn’t matter anyway, Peter was horrible at keeping secrets and May knew her nephew inside and out. She knew when something was wrong and when he started coming home happier and with a colorful pin on the inside of his jacket. 

After a few months, she confronted him about it. At first, she had wanted him to come to her about it when he was ready but she thought that pulling off the bandage would be easier and would save him the stress. Because of course, she would support him no matter what. It was a particularly good day when she decided to bring it up. 

“So Peter… do you remember when gay marriage was legalized and then a few months later, Ultron decided to be a thing and everyone blamed this end of the world on being nice to the gays.” 

“Uh, yeah. That was weird.” 

“Do you remember how happy I was when gay marriage was legalized.” 

“I don’t… I was not politically aware.” Peter said nervously. 

“I was very happy. Do you want to know why?”

“…why…”

“Because I’m Bisexual. I mean I was in a straight relationship with your uncle but I had a lot of lesbian friends, remember Audrey?”

“Yeah, she’s the blonde one right?” 

“Yup, She’s a lesbian, and we even dated for a bit in high school.” 

“Really? So you wouldn’t be mad if I said that I uh… wasn’t straight?”

“Why would I be mad? You’re literally a vigilante on your downtime, I would much rather have you be dating your friend than catch speeding cars for fun.” 

“I’m… not dating Ned.” Peter sputtered. May raised one of her eyebrows and Peter sighed. “Okay, that one time was be trying to change out of my Spider-Man suit it doesn’t count.” 

“Uh huh… Well, no wonder you idolize Mr. Stark so much. Not many proud queer people are also superheroes.” 

“You’d be surprised.” 

“Do you have some superhero gossip Spider-Man?” May grinned. 

“I haven’t met that many superheroes but Tony likes to talk. So you know Black Widow?” Peter grinned back. He didn’t think that it would be… this easy to talk about this kind of stuff to someone who meant so much to him but it was definitely a surprise to find out that his aunt was in the community too. Later he learned that she didn’t feel like she could talk about it because she married Ben and that was a pretty straight thing to do. She didn’t feel part of the community even though she liked girls just as much as she liked guys. 

But Peter promised her that she was still perfectly queer. They googled the dates for the next pride festival. And they started to plan for it even though Peter still wasn’t sure what flags he would wear, he didn’t even know what he identified as. May assured him that he’ll figure it out eventually and for the first time in years, Peter was able to breathe again.
